result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ

records.addlTxt: for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency.  Sent to JA/CA Br 1 for Judge's review

9:48 A.M. Defendant JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ in court.  Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court for JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin. Lack of communication. Attorney Golden move to withdraw. Court grants. DE to see PD. Victim present. Motion to remove no contact. State objects. Court denies. Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from victim requesting "no contact" be lifted.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:32 AM Attorney Matthew Loren Goldin in court for Defendant JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ. Prosecuting Atty Amanda Nash appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ not in court.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
filed by V1 requesting no contact to no violent contact be in place.

No contact with V1 in Oshkosh PD report #22-11902. 
COURT ALLOWS CONTACT WITH THE 600 BLOCK OF CEAPE AVE EFFECTIVE 5-17-2022

Defendant JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights compliance. Motion for bond modification.Victim present and makes statement.State objects to no contact w/V1. Court denies request but will allow contact with the 600 block of Ceape Ave effective 5-17-2022. (victim will be vacating residence today 5-16-2022)  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
09:12 AM Defendant JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ in court.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BAIL JUMP(DV), CDTP(DV), DC(DV), INTIMIDATE VICTIM/DISSUADE REPORTING(DV)
CONDITIONS:   No contact with V1 in Oshkosh PD report #22-11902.  No contact with the 600 block of Ceape Ave. Oshkosh.  May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

03:12 PM Defendant JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JOSEPH M. MISEVICZ appeared by video means.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  Victim addresses the Court.  DE advised of DNA rights.  Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender.  Advised of rights.  Record closed @ 3:23.
